description.narrative: The objectives of the Emergency COVID-19 (Coronavirus) Response Project in the Republic of Moldova are to prevent, detect and respond to the threat posed by the COVID-19 (Coronavirus) pandemic. The project comprises of two components. Component one is the Emergency COVID-19 (Coronavirus) response, which consists of four subcomponents: (i) Case Confirmation, which will finance medical supplies and equipment to support strengthening disease surveillance systems and the capacity of selected public health laboratories to confirm cases, (ii) Health System Strengthening will finance the strengthening of public health facilities to provide critical care to COVID-19 (Coronavirus) patients and minimize the risk that health care staff and other patients will be infected (iii) Communication Preparedness will support information and communication activities and (iv) Social and Financial Support to Households will support strengthening the social protection for the poor by amending the design of the Ajutor Social program. Component two consists of Implementation Management and Monitoring and Evaluation. This component will provide financing for project implementation, coordination, and management, including support for procurement, financial management (FM), environmental and social safeguards, and monitoring and evaluation of prevention and preparedness including third-party monitoring of progress.
